message: Discussion on the mailing list post: http://groups.google.com/group/pythonkc/browse_thread/thread/18103e4dbbc0060
Scrapy: A web scraping framework - 20 minutes
Those are the talks I'd be willing to give.  Feel free to star them if you're interested in them.  Maybe we can use this thread and format to collect talks and gauge interest in them.
i could do one on cygwin, a terminal emulator on windows and how to use it with python django if anyone wants me to - 30 mins
Hard to say because I could go longer. Also, I wonder if many people in this group are already using virtualenv anyway.
I could do an intro to virtualenv+pip (and maybe pythonbrew) ~ 20 min?
I would guess most people are using venv.  But I think it would still be a very valid topic and interesting to those new to python.
I just figured out how to connect to arduino using python and get real world data, so that could easily be 10-15 min presentation maybe get someone inspired to use arduino in the process :)
I should probably stop suggesting language talks after that look over the list of frameworks that I use...
I should probably stop suggesting language talks after that look over the list of frameworks that I use...
There's also the talk on decorators, for any new-to-intermediates that aren't utilizing them yet
@estebistec what about virtualenvwrapper? any chance you can squeeze it in there?
I can do some Unit Testing since it hasn't been mentioned (you're all writing unit tests aren't you?) unittest + nose -> 15 to 20 min.
Now there's a topic we could expand on with repeat presentations...
